{"step_by_step_thinking": "Proptosis is the abnormal protrusion or bulging of the eye. In a 5-year-old child, the most likely cause of proptosis is a tumor. The fact that the tumor is positive for Desmin immunohistochemical marker suggests a muscle origin. Based on these findings, the most likely diagnosis is embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma, which is a malignant tumor derived from skeletal muscle precursor cells.", "answer_choice": "B. Embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma"}
